# Medical Standard Operating Procedure
## M-1 Restriction of Duty [bold]M-1-A[/bold] - Senior Physicians and Chief Medical Officers are permitted to perform physical and/or psychological evaluations on NanoTrasen employees. Psychologists may perform psychological evaluations. If an evaluated employee is deemed physically or psychologically unfit, they may be placed on Medical Leave or assigned to Restricted Duty, depending on their condition and the discretion of the evaluating Medical personnel.
[bold]M-1-B[/bold] - The aforementioned Medical staff are permitted to temporarily place crew members on Medical Leave without an evaluation, given they have reasonable cause for concern regarding the employee’s physical or psychological state. The employee’s superior should be informed. This restriction only lasts until they receive an evaluation from a certified medical professional, who may return them to regular duties or extend the pre-existing Medical Leave at their own discretion. Command staff may also do the same for members of their department.
## M-2 Management of Chemicals - Chemicals that are capable of inducing an overdose are to be locked behind Medical access, whether that be inside a Medical Locker, behind an access-locked Smart Fridge, or kept inside the doors of the Medical department. Crew members carrying chemicals that are capable of causing an overdose must have a prescription or stamped permit to carry them. Medical employees performing their duties are the exception; This includes Chemists delivering prescriptions.
## M-3 Triage Procedure - [color=#1e90ff]Blue[/color]: Medical Staff > Command Staff > Security Personnel > Personnel with the most life-threatening injuries. - [color=#ff0000]Red[/color]: Medical Staff > Security Personnel > Command Staff > Personnel with the most life-threatening injuries. - [color=#008000]Green[/color]: Medical Staff > Personnel with the most life-threatening injuries.
- [color=#ffff00]Yellow[/color]: Medical Staff > Engineering Staff > Personnel with the most life-threatening injuries. - [color=#ee82ee]Violet[/color]: Medical Staff > Sick personnel > Personnel with the most life-threatening injuries.
## M-4 Handling of Dangerous Chemicals - Chemicals that are produced through the use of vestine are strictly illegal and must always be disposed of. Otherwise restricted and/or dangerous chemicals are permitted to be stored within the chemistry laboratory for safekeeping. However, these chemicals are still strictly prohibited from use without a stamped permit provided by the Chief Medical Officer.
## M-5 Post-Mortem Procedure - Upon the death of a patient that cannot be revived, the time of the patient’s death is to be called out for the department -- either verbally in person or over departmental communication lines. A death certificate or autopsy report is to be reported to Central Command. If possible, the next of kin is to be contacted and the post-mortem instructions are to be followed.
## M-6 Uniform - Medical staff are to be recognizable on sight, regardless of alert level. At all times, they must be wearing at least one departmentally recognizable article of clothing, whether it be their uniform or clothing associated with the Medical department. On Red alert, Medical staff must be wearing multiple identifiable articles of clothing and they must be immediately identifiable upon a first glance.
